refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The "system tray" or notification area is normally used for transient icons that indicate some special state. For example, a system tray icon might appear to tell the user that they have new mail, or have an incoming instant message, or something along those lines. The basic idea is that creating an icon in the notification area is less annoying than popping up a dialog.

A gtk.StatusIcon object can be used to display an icon in a "system tray". The icon can have a tooltip, and the user can interact with it by activating it or popping up a context menu. Critical information should not solely be displayed in a gtk.StatusIcon, since it may not be visible (e.g. when the user doesn't have a notification area on his panel). This can be checked with the gtk.StatusIcon.is_embedded() method.
On X11, the implementation follows the freedesktop.org "System Tray" specification. Implementations of the "tray" side of this specification can be found e.g. in the GNOME and KDE panel applications.
Note that a gtk.StatusIcon is not a widget, but just a gobject.GObject. Making it a widget would be impractical, since the system tray on Win32 doesn't allow to embed arbitrary widgets.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.get_storage_type

listitem.simpara: the image representation being used - one of the .

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Gets the type of representation being used by the gtk.StatusIcon to store image data. If the gtk.StatusIcon has no image data, the return value will be gtk.IMAGE_EMPTY.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.get_gicon

listitem.simpara: the displayed icon, or None if the image is empty.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.14 and above.

refsect2.para: Retrieves the gio.Icon() being displayed by the gtk.StatusIcon. The storage type of the status icon must be gtk.IMAGE_EMPTY or gtk.IMAGE_GICON. If this method fails, icon is left unchanged;

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.get_x11_window_id

listitem.simpara: An 32 bit unsigned integer identifier for the underlying X11 Window.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.14 and above.

refsect2.para: This function is only useful on the X11/freedesktop.org platform. It returns a window ID for the widget in the underlying status icon implementation. This is useful for the Galago notification service, which can send a window ID in the protocol in order for the server to position notification windows pointing to a status icon reliably.
This function is not intended for other use cases which are more likely to be met by one of the non-X11 specific methods, such as gtk.status_icon_position_menu().

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.get_pixbuf

listitem.simpara: the displayed pixbuf, or None if the image is empty.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Gets the gtk.gdk.Pixbuf being displayed by the gtk.StatusIcon. The storage type of the status icon must be gtk.IMAGE_EMPTY or gtk.IMAGE_PIXBUF (see the gtk.StatusIcon.get_storage_type() method).

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.get_stock

listitem.simpara: stock id of the displayed stock icon, or None if the image is empty.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Gets the id of the stock icon being displayed by the gtk.StatusIcon. The storage type of the status icon must be gtk.IMAGE_EMPTY or gtk.IMAGE_STOCK (see the gtk.StatusIcon.get_storage_type() method).

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.get_icon_name

listitem.simpara: name of the displayed icon, or None if the image is empty.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Gets the name of the icon being displayed by the gtk.StatusIcon. The storage type of the status icon must be gtk.IMAGE_EMPTY or gtk.IMAGE_ICON_NAME (see the gtk.StatusIcon.get_storage_type() method).

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.get_size

listitem.simpara: the size that is available for the image

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Gets the size in pixels that is available for the image. Stock icons and named icons adapt their size automatically if the size of the notification area changes. For other storage types, the "size-changed" signal can be used to react to size changes.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.set_tooltip

listitem.simpara: the tooltip text, or None

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Sets the tooltip of the status icon.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.set_visible

listitem.simpara: if True show the status icon, if False hide it

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Shows or hides a status icon.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.get_visible

listitem.simpara: True if the status icon is visible

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Returns True if the status icon is visible. Note that being visible does not guarantee that the user can actually see the icon, see also the gtk.StatusIcon.is_embedded() method.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.set_blinking

listitem.simpara: if True turn blinking on, if False turn it off

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Makes the status icon start or stop blinking. Note that blinking user interface elements may be problematic for some users, and thus may be turned off, in which case this setting has no effect.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.get_blinking

listitem.simpara: True if the icon is blinking

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Returns True if the icon is blinking, see the gtk.StatusIcon.set_blinking() method.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.is_embedded

listitem.simpara: True if the status icon is embedded in a notification area.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Returns True if the status icon is embedded in a notification area.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.get_geometry

listitem.simpara: a 3-tuple (containing the screen, area occupied by the status icon and the panel orientation) or None.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Returns information in a 3-tuple about the location of the status icon on screen. The 3-tuple contains the gtk.gdk.Screen, the area occupied by the status icon as a gtk.gdk.Rectangle and the orientation of the panel containing the statis icon - one of the . This information can be used to e.g. position popups like notification bubbles. See the gtk.status_icon_position_menu() function for a more convenient alternative for positioning menus.
Note that some platforms do not provide this information.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.get_screen

listitem.simpara: a gtk.gdk.Screen.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Returns the gtk.gdk.Screen associated with status_icon.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.set_screen

listitem.simpara: a gtk.gdk.Screen.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.12 and above.

refsect2.para: Sets the gtk.gdk.Screen where status_icon is displayed; if the icon is already mapped, it will be unmapped, and then remapped on the new screen.

refsect2.title: gtk.status_icon_new_from_pixbuf

listitem.simpara: a new gtk.StatusIcon

refsect2.para: Creates a status icon displaying pixbuf. The image will be scaled down to fit in the available space in the notification area, if necessary.

refsect2.title: gtk.status_icon_new_from_file

listitem.simpara: a new gtk.StatusIcon

refsect2.para: Creates a status icon displaying the image in the file specified by filename. The image will be scaled down to fit in the available space in the notification area, if necessary.

refsect2.title: gtk.status_icon_new_from_gicon

listitem.simpara: a new gtk.StatusIcon

refsect2.para: Creates a status icon displaying a gio.Icon(). If the icon is a themed icon, it will be updated when the theme changes.

refsect2.title: gtk.status_icon_new_from_stock

listitem.simpara: a stock icon id
a new gtk.StatusIcon

refsect2.para: Creates a status icon displaying a stock icon. Sample stock icon names are gtk.STOCK_OPEN, gtk.STOCK_QUIT. You can register your own stock icon names, see the gtk.IconFactory.add_default() and gtk.IconFactory.add() methods.

refsect2.title: gtk.status_icon_new_from_icon_name

listitem.simpara: an icon name
a new gtk.StatusIcon

refsect2.para: Creates a status icon displaying an icon from the current icon theme. If the current icon theme is changed, the icon will be updated appropriately.

refsect2.title: gtk.status_icon_position_menu

listitem.simpara: the gtk.Menu
the gtk.StatusIcon

a 3-tuple containing the x and y coordinates for the menu and a boolean indicating whether the menu should be pushed in to be completely inside the screen instead of just clamped to the size to the screen.

refsect2.para: Menu positioning function to use with the popup() method to position menu aligned to statusicon .
Eample use of this function is:
refsect2.programlisting: menu.popup(None, None, gtk.status_icon_position_menu, event.button, event.time, statusicon)

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.set_name

listitem.simpara: the name.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.22 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_name() method sets the name of this tray icon. This should be a string identifying this icon. It is may be used for sorting the icons in the tray and will not be shown to the user.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.set_title

listitem.simpara: the title.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.22 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_title() method sets the title of this tray icon. This should be a short, human-readable, localized string describing the tray icon. It may be used by tools like screen readers to render the tray icon.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.get_title

listitem.simpara: the title of the status icon.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.22 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_title() method gets the title of this tray icon.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.set_has_tooltip

listitem.simpara: True if the status icon has a tooltip, False otherwise.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.16 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_has_tooltip() method sets the "has-tooltip" property.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.get_has_tooltip

listitem.simpara: True if the status icon has a tooltip, False otherwise..

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.16 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_has_tooltip() method returns the current value of the "has-tooltip" property.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.set_tooltip_text

listitem.simpara: the contents of the tooltip for the status icon, or None.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.16 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_tooltip_text() method sets text as the contents of the tooltip. This function will take care of setting the "has-tooltip" property to True and of the default handler for the "query-tooltip" signal.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.get_tooltip_text

listitem.simpara: the tooltip text, or None.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.16 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_tooltip_text() method gets the contents of the tooltip for the status icon.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.set_tooltip_markup

listitem.simpara: the contents of the tooltip for widget, or None.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.16 and above.

refsect2.para: The set_tooltip_markup() method sets markup as the contents of the tooltip, which is marked up with the Pango text markup language. This function will take care of setting the "has-tooltip" property to True and of the default handler for the "query-tooltip" signal.

refsect2.title: gtk.StatusIcon.get_tooltip_markup

listitem.simpara: the tooltip text, or None.

note.para: This method is available in PyGTK 2.16 and above.

refsect2.para: The get_tooltip_markup() method gets the contents of the tooltip for the status icon.

refsect2.title: The "activate" gtk.StatusIcon Signal

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)

note.para: This signal is available in GTK+ 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Gets emitted when the user activates the status icon. If and how status icons can be activated is platform-dependent.

refsect2.title: The "popup-menu" gtk.StatusIcon Signal

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
the button that was pressed, or 0 if the signal is not emitted in response to a button press event
the timestamp of the event that triggered the signal emission
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)

note.para: This signal is available in GTK+ 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Gets emitted when the user brings up the context menu of the status icon. Whether status icons can have context menus and how these are activated is platform-dependent.
The button and activate_time parameters should be passed as the last two arguments to the gtk.Menu.popup() method.

refsect2.title: The "size-changed" gtk.StatusIcon Signal

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal
the new size
the first user parameter (if any) specified with the connect() method
additional user parameters (if any)
True if the icon was updated for the new size. Otherwise, GTK+ will scale the icon as necessary.

note.para: This signal is available in GTK+ 2.10 and above.

refsect2.para: Gets emitted when the size available for the image changes, e.g. because the notification area got resized.
